snippet: A military defense team found new evidence that cast doubt on decade-old terrorism charges and offers a case study on how those deemed to be low-level insurgents remain stuck at Guantánamo Bay.
abstract: Military defense team finds new evidence that casts doubt on decade-old terrorism charges and offers a case study on how those deemed to be low-level insurgents remain stuck at Guantanamo Bay; one man named Obaydullah, was charged before a tribunal in September 2008 with providing material support to terrorism, but new investigation raises doubt about his involvement; he is not an important enough figure to be a bargaining chip in connection with talks to end the war.
lead_paragraph: A military defense team found new evidence that cast doubt on decade-old terrorism charges and offers a case study on how those deemed to be low-level insurgents remain stuck at Guantánamo Bay.

headline.main: Questions Raised in Afghan Detainee’s Case
headline.print_headline: New Questions Raised In Afghan Detainee Case

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
